page.title: 09LIFE IN NETTLEDEN
page.content: HOUSING:{Nettleden}is situated in rural Hertfordshire in close proximity to Berkhamsted.The village has 14 houses, no shops, and is a closely knit community. The properties have been converted from farm labourers cottages and are surrounded by large gardens. HOMELIFE: The houses here all have modern conveniences including electricity, gas,and hot and cold water.There are no main drains, the community relies upon cess pits,which are emptied regularly by the Sludge Gulper.There is no local industry other than farming but fruit and vegetables are grown by the inhabitants. COMMUNICATIONS:Most of the inhabitants are COMMUTERS & the nearest main towns are Berkhamsted & Hemel Hempstead which are used for shopping & entertainment & swimming.
